alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 6:45PM MST until February 24 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches, except 8 to 16 inches on southwest facing slopes above 9,500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Far Northwest Highlands, Jemez Mountains, Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Tusas Mountains Including Chama and Chuska Mountains. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. Tire chains may be necessary if traveling through mountain passes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds will result in blowing and drifting snow with poor visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
